conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and properties of processes on a p-V diagram.
State A: p_A = 3 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 1 x 10^-3 m^3; State B: p_B = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 1 x 10^-3 m^3; State C: p_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
Temperature at state A is 27째C, which is 300 K.
Set up a ratio using the ideal gas law for states A and C.
Formulate the temperature ratio: (p_C V_C)/(p_A V_A) = T_C/T_A.
Substitute known values: (1 x 10^5 Pa)(3 x 10^-3 m^3)/(3 x 10^5 Pa)(1 x 10^-3 m^3) = T_C/300 K.
Simplify the ratio: 1 = T_C/300 K, so T_C = 300 K.
Convert T_C back to Celsius: T_C (째C) = 300 - 273.15 = 26.85 째C.
The temperature of the gas at state C is approximately 26.85째C.
